If you like mil-sims, you will enjoy this. It isn't as painful as other mil-sims, so this might be a casual one. You lean left and right, and you have some serious recoil to control when fighting. When being shot at, you react as an actual human being, unlike other games, your gun sways under fire. You get to choose your primary and secondary, meanwhile customizing them to call your own. Like one shot kills? Choose the L1A1, a scope, and add AP ammo (i prefer red dot sight). Do you like bunkering down behind cover and spraying a hundred bullets in the time frame of 15 seconds? Choose the Galil AR, and add a bi-pod, and maybe some brutal hollow or AP rounds to dish out some more damage, and you can defend a point against hundreds of jihads. This game is likely the best shooter I've ever played, and ties with CSGO and maybe some Modern Warfare games. Buy it as soon as you can. I've been playing Insurgency on and off for the past year, and in that time I can honestly say that this game trumps the big AAA titles. Even with a small team these guys were able to topple the giants aka 'COD' 'BF'. It's so refreshing to see a game where the devs actually care. These devs have been constantly involved with the game, providing frequent improvements and updates based on community feedback. And the best thing is.... They aren't charging for us for it. Where other companies try to squeeze every last doller out of the consumer, New World Interactive just keeps on giving.   Now lets go through the pros and cons;   Pros:   Modding Community Sound design Co-op UI Gunplay, guns actually have recoil :)  Optimisation - I'm running the game on max settings at 1440p and getting 140fps average!!!   Cons: Can be very challenging and unforgiving for new players   Overall I give Insurgency a 9.5/10

As a real-life gun enthusiast and gun owner, i can tell you that this game's realism is just about as real as they come. What do i mean? Let me explain.  The guns. I'm one of those guys that watches every person holding a gun in any movie and nitpicks how they're handling the weapon. The guns are insanely realistic, from the way you load the magazines, to the way they sound (I own the semi auto version of the AC556 and i can tell you it sounds just like it does in real life), to the recoil. You wanna rock full auto? You better prepare yourself for a ton of recoil and virtually no accuracy, just like in real life.   Also, another small detail is how the character models keep their finger off the trigger when they're reloading or crawling on the ground with their weapon. Critical rule of real life gun safety: keep your finger off the trigger until you're ready to fire. It's just cool stuff like that that makes me really like this game.  Also really like how one or two shots usually takes someone down, which is pretty realistic, depending on where you would hit your target. Got shot in the legs? That'll slow you down and you probably wont have time to get cover, and you'll die.   Also like how when you're looking through a scope, only what you see THROUGH the scope is magnified, not the entire world outside the scope as in every other game. Another cool little feature.  Teamwork and communication wins here. Watch every corner, don't run around like a fool or you'll die.   If you want the most realistic close quarters FPS game, this is it, and I've played a lot of them, from gamecube Medal of honors and PC's BF2, to a ton of F2P FPS's, to battlefield 3 and 4 and COD Black Ops, etc. Everything feels authentic here. Is it perfect? No. Is it really close? Yes.

The security forces scream Jesus Christ but I never hear the insurgents scream Allahu Akbar.   0/10 broken game   Real Review:  It's highly reliant on team-play (lone wolves don't last long) with realistic damage models and HUD settings. But it also has the arcade-like experience you'd find in say, Battlefield or CS:GO. Graphically the game is fairly decent, especially for a non-AAA title, and stuff like SweetFX and Reshades can certainly enhance the game even more. Game sizes are pretty sweet, its not as confined as the 6v6 CoD hallways, but it's also not the massive war-zones with 64 players on each side as found in the Battlefield series. This may sound like a bad thing but it's actually extremely enjoyable, you still have the practicality of all types of weaponry, but it's also not a game where you HAVE to have explosives in case of a random M1A2 or Tunguska ruining your day. Maps aren't really all that diverse compared to other shooters seeing how it specifically takes place in the Iraq-Syria region, but it's got everything, small riverside towns, urban debris-ridden metropolises, massive foreign affairs facilities, woodlands, snow-capped villages, you name it, just don't expect to be fighting in the Wall Street Exchange or Fisher's Market of Hong Kong or something. Insurgency is a game that is simultaniously suited for everyone and no-one, seeing as how the 'hardcore' damage and systems seem to turn off many would-be players, but for those who do take it upon themselves, you'll have a blast. Now have a small tutorial on how to make scrambled eggs cause imma make some right now.  1: You'll need 1-3 eggs tops and olive oil, at least that's what I use, salt is optional but recommended. If you don't have all that fancy stuff, just get a bowl, a decent sized fork and a pan.  2: Once all the egg stuff is in the bowl, you're gonna want to start mixing and spinning it with the fork, do this for about 30-45 seconds.  3: Once the egg is decently mixed you can put it on the pan BUT be sure to apply the olive oil on the pan first.  4: Keep an eye on it, flip it around cause thats how a pan works. Spatula highly recommended.  5: Once it's decently cooked, extract it with the spatula and you're done. I suggest getting toasted bread or tortillas to handle the scrambled eggs, good for extra flavor as well.

Boss as

RPG.  The first time you hear it in the game and die three-quarters of a second later, you will think it was just your carelessness and take it stride.  The next five times after you die to this, you will rage and cry about how unfair it is. Sometimes without warning, but sometimes you die gloriously surrounded by dozens of enemies.  And as you die more and more to that flying deathstick of doom; everytime you hear 'AR-PEE-GEE!' your butt will clench tightly shut in dreaded anticipation of what is about to come.   But eventually, the word RPG will no longer bring anger and frustration, but a type of quiet acceptance as your butt no longer clenches, but relaxes as the thick head soaring on wings of fire flies towards you.  It does not discriminate in class, whether you're a machinegunner lying prone on the floor or a Recon dashing for cover, the RPG will teach you humility, acceptance of Fate, and fine butt-muscle control with its smooth torpedo-like head.  RPG In these letters. In this word. In this game. You will find inner peace.  10/10 Would achieve Nirvana again.

Having a mouse clicker is not cheating; it does not touch the game itself, and shouldn't ever warrant a permanent VAC ban.

Have you ever wanted to move in to a room, guns at the ready, and get shot in the head?   This is the game for you.  Have you ever wanted to turn a corner, see an insurgent, and your teammate walks in front of you and you shoot him in the head?  This is the game for you.  Have you felt like you dont get enough simulated balistics and gunplay from other games, and you wish they actually felt like you were killing someone when you fired?  Yeah this is definitely for you.  Dakka-dakka simulator is here for you.  In all seriousness this is an extremely fun game, with matches ranging from 10-40 minutes depending on what you're doing, and how competent either team is at a base tactical level. Its definitely not for those looking for an arcade shooter, and there are times where you're gonna end up on a rather lackluster team that doesn't understand how to play the game, but thats okay becuase the gameplay as a whole makes it worth it with a rather simple upgrade system for your weapons that allows you to pick scope attatchments, grips/bipods, ammo type (only 3 so far) ,lights/lasers and armor type, with a simplistic class selection ranging from snipers, squad gunners, demolitions experts, and squad marksmen.  10/10 would get shot in the head again.

This game is exactly what a tactical shooter should be. It is very polished given that it is not built from the ground up (including the engine) with creating this game in mind given that this is built from the source engine. I think this game reminds me of exactly what CoD and similar franchises started with and it's that type of game play that makes this game great! It also reminds me of some of the older shooters from my early PC gaming days. I get the same nostalgic feeling that I had when I was playing Delta Force in the late 90s and early 2000s. The game seems to have a great mix of tactics and skill allowing players who lack in one to compensate with the other. Unlike BattleField or other shooters this game allows the possibility to really be a one man army if given the chance. The damage model is trying to emulate realism and therefore a single player could take out an entire team if he played well. In games like BattleField or newer CoD games it takes more or less an entire clip to take out an enemy. Which makes running in the open less of a problem and the possibility of multiple frags at a time less likely. 10/10

I loved it as a Source modification and was in complete surprise when I learned I had to buy the game on Steam. I didn't even know it became its own game. I had fun moving my cursor around just to see how the weapons would move around the screen. The new maps are all crafted well (although I wish more of the modification's were present) and all game modes are great. I think I played the game for the first few months solely on the cooperative mode against the AI and then moved on to playing against other players. Both are put together extremely well and every minute of the game (okay, maybe not when I'm getting mad) is enjoyable.   Totally worth the money to buy it for yourself, but why not just get it for you and your friends instead?

Absolutely solid gameplay, a spirit successor to DOD: Source. This is the polar opposite of a run and gun game whilst not being long winded and boring. It has the perfect balance of simulation and pace of play. The way guns handle, sound and look are truly accurate and the loadout selection and mechanics are perfectly balanced. Each weapon has an effective range making the fire rate of a bolt action worth it, and with there being a lot of fire selectable/semi auto firearms (especially with the DOI mod) this gives character and preference to each rifle. Aiming and accuracy is great and realistic, damage is well mapped and balanced (you're gonna get a guaranteed kill with anything point blank to the head, but you're not gonna be sniping with a pistol)  I highly reccommend trying cooperative modes too, the bot AI is as good as human logic, even more difficult than multiplayer on harder settings.  Overall 9/10, An awesome game with top quality immersion (avoid servers with sound mods..). only downside is the source engine graphics (this is a lot better in the Day of Imfamy standalone, and will be much much better when moved to the Unreal engine).

Want a tough, unforgiving FPS game that focuses in on the essence of modern combat?   Buy Insurgency.   Want to spend 8 hours getting your face blown off and the next 200 laughing and blowing off everyone else's?   Buy Insurgency.   Want to be a part of a small, FRIENDLY, competitive gaming community?  Buy Insurgency.   This game hits every one of the checkboxes for a modern competitive shooter.   You can expect quick, satisfying combat. Every bullet means something when just  one  can have you taking a dirt nap. Your movements must be deliberate, but quick. You need to be conscious of your enemies' surroundings without a mini-map. Being immersed is an advantage in Insurgency. The game has excellent sound design, type 'snd_obstruction_enable 1' to enable audio occlusion, which sounds that come through walls to sound muffled, super awesome. Maps are balanced and beautiful too, especially considering the game runs on the dated, but still viable Source engine.  Do yourself a huge favor and pick up Insurgency the next time it is on sale (or even at full price).     Highly recommended.

Started playing a few days back, so far this game is still a magnet to me.  I mainly play in the Singapore server, the player base is pretty nice, a lot of them seems to be experienced on the game, which adds the challenge to the game, although it's quite hard to co-ordinate with others, who are mostly silent on the mic. The graphics are okay, although there's room for improvements skin-wise (more detailed skins, more varieties on the skins), physics-wise, and effects-wise (with the latter 2 being the most noticeable downside for me). The devs should tone down the ragdoll when a character gets killed, and lower the particle intensity when bullets hit the wall / ground while they're at it. The gameplay is fun, especially when you get the hang of the controls and weapon characteristics. The game pushes you to make quick tactical decisions absent from other faster paced shooters. Overall, I recommend this game for those who want a team-work based, medium paced tactical shooter with okay graphics.

This game is somewhat old, and yet I feel it is still the best game i've played since Battlefield 3, and when I played the Battlefield series i had thought it was the most realistic (on hardcore mode at least) but after playing this game for about a week and learning about all of the intense gameplay and the wide variety of mods, I can honestly say for the money this is the best game you can buy on steam and probably will be for the next few years, Im amazed they still release content for this game and its great to see how long of a lifespan this game has. I bought CSGO before this game and I wasn't big on CSGO after I bought it and I felt cheated out of a tactical game, when i bought this it was more than I expected and took me by surprise, I thought this game would be like battlefield, and in a sense it is, but more realistic, and honestly I think this is what Counterstrike should have been, this game has a similar concept and is 100 times better and requires more skill than a game without an aiming mechanic, and the game requires you to chat with your team to work together, I never felt more aligned with my own team than in this game, the importance of teamwork speaks out in this game big time and I think the only one that might be bigger once its out of alpha (as far as teamwork) would be Squad, but at the moment if you have extra money or just want a great game than don't hesitate to buy this game, its difficult to learn but extremely fun once you get the hang of it. 10/10 Best game of 2016-2142

This is my favorite shooter of all time. If you enjoy FPS games or source engine shooters, definitely give Insurgency a try. I got it in early access at $14.99 and thought it was a steal. It currently sells at $9.99 after adding content so you're basically ripping off the devs. Speaking of, New World Interactive has treated this game and it's community right. An actual success of early access, NWI continually updates bugs and adds content for free. They listen to their community as well as embrace the modding community. Day of Infamy being a perfect example as they created a stand alone for a mod of Insurgency. But we're here to talk about Insurgency...  Insurgency likes to be categorized as a tactical shooter in part to it's high damage models. I picked it up in early access because I kept hearing that, and that team work and communication is key. While team work and communication will guaruntee success, there is still room to have fun and run and gun, however, you have to be smart about it. This isn't Call of Duty, but I don't want to scare you away with the term 'tactical'. Over the years it has gained a wide enough audience that it's strayed from it's tight knit team work play style a little. If you work with your team though, you will fare a lot better. Especially if you want to move into the competitive/ranked side of the community.  It works on a class system which you have a certain amount of points to spend on weapons, attachments, accessories like grenades and armor. This limits certain weapons to certain classes, like snipers for marksmen classes, etc. The points limit you to make a choice of maxing out your weapon with attachments while skimping armor/grenades, or balancing them across equipment. Each piece also adds weight to your player which will affect your speed. All of this makes for balancing gunfights which are smooth and reliable. I personally love the gunplay in this game over your Counterstrikes, Battlefields, and Call of Dutys. It's as if I can feel the weapons through the mouse, if that makes any sense. Almost as if there's some weight behind each weapon.  For the $9.99 you get 24 maps, some are night versions, all with a variety of scenarios. There are some tight urban environments and also some more open, desert landscapes. The night maps add a completely different challenge. Also, if you don't want to play PvP multiplayer, they have a PvE coop mode against bots, and also a single player mode against bots. You really can't go wrong with this game at $9.99 and if you want to wait a little bit, I'm sure you can get it on sale for under $5. I've seen some reviews that say the graphics are bad, but for source engine, I think they look great. Of course they are a little dated due to the engine but it's a lot prettier than most games and they aren't super demanding for the lower tier PCs out there. Also, the sounds are good, but if you want to really feel like you're in the action, check out the workshop for some sound enhancing mods. You will feel as if you are in the game and ♥♥♥♥ your pants. This game makes me scared when I play it. I physically shake from adrenaline. Don't sleep on Insurgency.

Holy gawd damn I dont even know where to start. This game is one of the only games that I will binge-play for hours on end because every single time a round ends, it is a new experience. This game is outstanding. It has a pretty good community, wide selection of guns and accessories, and like millions of maps, not to mention the ones on the workshop.    The workshop is one of the main reasons I like the game. The workshop offers endless amounts of fun because there are endless amounts of varieties. The workshop showcases gun skins, guns in general, sound packs, maps, you name it. It is great because it lets you play the game how you want.    Another thing about this game is the reality. the blood splatters, the fogginess when you get shot, the gun dynamics, the sounds and feels, Jesus, this is just the beginning. You can talk to teamates with command shortcuts that saw pretty much all that you need to say. There is also voicechat and regular chat. Just like any other game, you meet a lot of cool people. Oh, and one more thing: I absolutely love the lack of information that the game gives you. No killfeed, hitmarkers, sometimes even announcments. These make it realistic and creates a whole new experience.     This is just the beginning. I absolutely love the feel of this game (note my hours played). I am really exited that it will be upgraded to the Unreal Engine system. The graphics are getting out of date, but the overhaul should refresh it. I recommend this game 1,000 times over. Support these Indie devolopers, they are just trying to make the world a better place. :)

So you want to allah akbar? well if you're coming for a game like COD this is going to be a very interesting change for you, and if you're coming from a game like Battlfield or CS, the transtition should be ever so slightly easier. overall I think this game is great and i give it a 9.3/10 the only thing i would want is just more content, and better graphics. but im very pleased with my purchase. You can get this game for pretty cheap on sites like IndieGala. I would highly recommend this game to anyone who likes FPS, and is looking to go to the more tactical side without slowing the pacing to a snail crawl. plus you can use workshop content to make alot of thinks look better.  Pros: you can greatly change up your loadout from life to life. squard roles prevent there from being 15 snipers in the back of the map. realistic recoil, makes you learn to tap fire, and use burst mode. realistic bullet penetration, through walls and if you dont have armor. teaches you not to run out into combat and 360 no scope faze 420 blaze it AMAZING workshop content great level design (most of the time) have only in countered one possible hacker (or he is just really good). teaches you to work with your team, even if you dont have a mic. if there is someone killing you on the left side of the map everytime, it teaches you....you probably shouldnt go left next life. Also punishes you for dying (long spawn times, and limited amount of respawns), this is more for people who are looking to run & gun. it teaches you to careful.  Cons: eo-tech and kobra sights are meh. i replaced them with ones from the workshop, it feels almost like cheating becuase they are so much better than the stock ones. low player count some weapons are just bad. (fal in my opinon) some maps can be one sided on certain points. IM LOOKING AT YOU B ON MARKET. (but it is always possible, you just need to work as a team)  Tips: He who shoots first, usually wins. or just get good at aiming.  akm, m16, sks, and m14 are all you need to know. avoid holding down the trigger if at all possible TAP FIRE IS YOUR BEST FRIEND you only need one burst with an m16 or two rounds with and akm to down your opponent with ap rounds. dont hug corners, you will lower your weapon, and watch for your barrel sticking out, it will give you away. unlike in BF4, DMR's are very useful, so dont be afraid to run with one.  and for very long distances, like the first point on sinjar, use single fire, to conserve ammo. for recoil, on m16 the heavy barrel is really all you need, but you will want to get the foregrip with the akm. you will need to make sacrifices if you want to be decent on the field. some times you will have to go without a sight, or sidearm, in exchange for body armour, or on a night map you may need nvg's which can cost you a grenade and sidearm. USE AP ROUNDS. they are worth every single point. hp rounds are also very good. tracer rounds are bad in general since they give you away. dont rage quit, some times you just need take a breath and move slower. AND ABOVE ALL WORK AS A TEAM AND HAVE FUN!

I bought this game a while back on sale. For some reason it sat in my collection collecting virtual dust. I grew tired of playing other shooters and recently jumped into this with a friend. As I jumped into a coop game with a friend, I'm wondering what took me so ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ long and how stupid I felt that this game had been there waiting for me to put in meaningful time into it. Now I am hooked. This game requires patience, its not a game you jump into and just spray and pray and are instantly good at. The game is built on working together, not that its a requirement, but the flow of matches is a lot smoother with communication, pretty much like any other game. I guess there is a realism appeal here though, you do NOT have an ammo count, so you are forced to pay attention to the rounds youve dispensed. There is no health bar, and it does not regenerate, as a matter of fact, you die in at most 3 shots, as long as they are well placed at centermass at the very least. The hud is very minimal, which forces you to take in the environment and approach your angles cautiously. I ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥ i n g love it. The graphics are great, the gameplay is amazing and smooth, the multiplayer is intense considering how cautious you have to be, which slows things down a bit but not in a bad way what so ever. The coop is amazingly fun especially with friends. There is definitely a sense of accomplishment when you and your crew jump in, take this objective, or blow this objective up, and just work together, watching over one another. I definitely reccommend this game over amd over, especially at the price it reaches during the Summer or Winter sale. Easily worth even the full priced value as well.

Learning your role in the squad, how to perform it and the best gear to use. -Squad Training. Learning how to actually perform as a squad, keeping cover of teammates, covering flanks. -Clear Order. I was introduced to Insugency by my brother, and so far am very impressed.  Playing coop mode with my brother and our mate, communication and coodination are key, and gives us an excellent experience of tactical play. We cover each others' advances, point out enemy locations, and coodinate to cover points of entry when facing a counter-attack. We move as one unit, and it feels excellent when we're successful.  There are no crosshairs, so you have to rely on your weapon sights, no ammo counter (only a counter for how many magazines you have left), and no big arrows pointing to where incoming fire is coming from. All of this adds to the enjoyment of the game, it forces you to be careful, to look for the enemy, and look out for your team mates. And when your gun goes 'click', you'll be glad you equipped that side arm; reloading a rifle takes a couple of seconds which could cost you your life.  Insurgency also gives you a great atmosphere. Being a Source engine game, yes, the graphics appear a little outdated, but once playing you don't really notice. Weapons make realist sounds and handle with more realism than other shooters. When bullets start landing around you, you hear the cracks as they strike and the dust they kick up can obscure your view, further adding to the atmosphere. When you're being suppressed by the enemy you really know about it, and if you don't keep your head down, one stray shot can take you out.   Equipment customisation is also good. There are a selection of various weapons for the different classes, with sevaral scopes, foregrips, laser or flashlight attachments, heavy barrels, and even different ammo types to choose from. Not to mention the ability to swap out your body armour, explosives, sidearms, etc. There is a points system in place and each piece of equipment costs, so you have to weigh up your options when choosing your equipment and find a combination that works for your play style.  This game delivers excellent cooperative, tactical team play, something I often crave from games these days. Not only that, it executes it well and provides a hell of a lot of fun in the process. We enjoy it so much we're planning to set up our own priate server!  The price is also good at only £5.99, though at the time of writing this it was currently on offer for £2.39 on the Humble Store, redeamable on Steam. You really can't turn your nose up at that!

Insurgency is a great tactical and team based game, and it really shows for the first 10-20 hours. The large player games and different modes make it an interesting, unforgiving, and fun experience, but there are some major flaws. With the modes in the game, all of them revolve around taking and holding points for reinforcements. That, or destroying/taking an objective. You will almost always be able to find games in every category, but some are definitely played more than others. With that said, I feel there needs to be more depth of some sort, because what the game really comes down to is killing, getting killed and taking points, that's every mode in every game. Maybe have moving objectives or mobile ones even; or perhaps an industrial or mansion type environment that represents one large objective that needs to be cleared. Overall, Insurgency needs more varience in game modes. As far as repetition goes, it starts to wear out. With the games 'realism', you will be dying a lot, and on some maps, particularly the large and open ones, you'll be dying consecutively for sometimes the entire match; yes even with decent teamplay. In general, it's fun, but not for everyone. Try to get it on a sale.

Insurgency is one of those rare gems of a game and it's kind of a shame that it isn't as popular or well known as it should be. Insurgency is like the Counter Strike you've always wanted. It doesn't have a high skill ceiling, all the weapons and classes are equally balanced yet drastically different, the maps feel like actual locations stuck in the middle of military conflict and not like they were designed to be multiplayer maps specifically. The weapons in this game feel amazing. From the way they shoot to the way they sway at your hip, they actually feel like they have weight to them. Player movement is also pretty decent for a game useing the source engine. Your soldier's speed and locomotion is determined based on how much equipment you're carrying, and that plays a huge role in how agile you are. Now if you've played CoD or Battlefield and are used to the whole 'run-and-gun' aspect of those games, I have to warn you now to completely forget that and to start playing more tactfully. Insurgency is hard, but very fair. You need to play smart while still being forceful. You cannot lone-wolf in this game or else you'll lose and get kicked by your teammates. The community for Insurgency is pretty friendly to new and old players alike. I really can't recommend this game enough..

While probably 90% of my time in this game has been spent in Co-op PvE against bots, I still believe that I can recommend this game. And boy do I recommend it.   This game will kick your ♥♥♥. It'll make you fear for your virtual life. It will make you so frustrated. Whenever someone asks me what Insurgency is about, I always say 'Imagine being dropped straight into Afghanistan'. This game hates you, but that's why it's so easy to love.  Now, like I said, I have almost no PvP multiplayer experience. I think My KDR in PvP is something like 5/40? But still, the bots are no pushovers, either. They have a lot of dumb moments, yes. Many times, a bit will slide into the middle of a room looking at the ceiling. Other times, though, they will shoot you in the head if you aren't quick enough. I remember once my whole team was heading through an archway when all the sudden, one of our characters says 'OH SH** RPG!'. We all died. It killed every single one of us.  This game will always have a very special place in my heart.

Excellent FPS team based shooter. Doesn't reward team gameplay as much as it rewards tactical movement and a good loadout. TTK is very realistic and custom skins can be loaded in for free on the workshop as well as new sound kits. Heaps of potential. Kind of a faster Squad with excellent movement systems and firefights are intense and immersive. Grenades and explosives need balancing. 9/10
It was ok

If you're looking for a more realistic and tactical approach in the FPS genre, this game is for you.  Try to COD out in the open, you're dead. Try to COD through a corner, you're dead. Try to COD in a fire fight, you'll most likely be dead.  10/10 will COD it out never again.
